segment.source: Reduce the Size of the Component Store in an Offline Windows Image
segment.target: Reduce the Size of the Component Store in an Offline Windows Image

segment.source: Reduce the Size of the Component Store in an Offline Windows Image
segment.target: Reduce the Size of the Component Store in an Offline Windows Image

segment.source: Reduce the Size of the Component Store in an Offline Windows Image
segment.target: Reduce the Size of the Component Store in an Offline Windows Image

segment.source: You can use the Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM) tool to mount a Windows image from a WIM, VHD, or VHDX file and modify it.
segment.target: You can use the Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM) tool to mount a Windows image from a WIM, VHD, or VHDX file and modify it.

segment.source: Analyze and clean up the Component Store (WinSxS folder) in an offline Windows image
segment.target: Analyze and clean up the Component Store (WinSxS folder) in an offline Windows image

segment.source: To complete the walkthrough, you need the following:
segment.target: To complete the walkthrough, you need the following:

segment.source: A computer running Windows 10, Windows 8.1, Windows 8, Windows 7, Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview, Windows Server 2012 R2, Windows Server 2012, or Windows Server 2008 R2 with the Windows 8.1 version of the Windows ADK tools installed on it.
segment.target: A computer running Windows 10, Windows 8.1, Windows 8, Windows 7, Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview, Windows Server 2012 R2, Windows Server 2012, or Windows Server 2008 R2 with the Windows 8.1 version of the Windows ADK tools installed on it.

segment.source: A .wim, .vhd, or .vhdx file of a Windows 10 or Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview image.
segment.target: A .wim, .vhd, or .vhdx file of a Windows 10 or Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview image.

segment.source: Analyze the size of the Component Store in an offline Windows image
segment.target: Analyze the size of the Component Store in an offline Windows image

segment.source: Copy a .wim file, a .vhd, or a .vhdx that contains a Windows image, to the local drive.
segment.target: Copy a .wim file, a .vhd, or a .vhdx that contains a Windows image, to the local drive.

segment.source: For example, C:testimages.
segment.target: For example, C:testimages.

segment.source: Click Start, and type deployment.
segment.target: Click Start, and type deployment.

segment.source: Right-click Deployment and Imaging Tools Environment and then select Run as administrator.
segment.target: Right-click Deployment and Imaging Tools Environment and then select Run as administrator.

segment.source: Create a folder for your mounted image.
segment.target: Create a folder for your mounted image.

segment.source: For example, C:testoffline.
segment.target: For example, C:testoffline.

segment.source: Run the DISM /Get-ImageInfo command to retrieve the name or index number for the image that you want to update.
segment.target: Run the DISM /Get-ImageInfo command to retrieve the name or index number for the image that you want to update.

segment.source: For example:
segment.target: For example:

segment.source: Mount the Windows image.
segment.target: Mount the Windows image.

segment.source: For example:
segment.target: For example:

segment.source: Since WIM files can contain one or more images, you must specify an index or name value.
segment.target: Since WIM files can contain one or more images, you must specify an index or name value.

segment.source: To mount an image from a VHD, you must specify .
segment.target: To mount an image from a VHD, you must specify .

segment.source: Analyze the size of the component store.
segment.target: Analyze the size of the component store.

segment.source: For example:
segment.target: For example:

segment.source: To understand the different values provided in the display, see Determine the Actual Size of the WinSxS Folder.
segment.target: To understand the different values provided in the display, see Determine the Actual Size of the WinSxS Folder.

segment.source: If the component store cleanup was recommended in the displayed report, then you can start cleanup of the image.
segment.target: If the component store cleanup was recommended in the displayed report, then you can start cleanup of the image.

segment.source: For example:
segment.target: For example:

segment.source: You can reduce the size of the component store further by adding the /ResetBase parameter.
segment.target: You can reduce the size of the component store further by adding the /ResetBase parameter.

segment.source: For example:
segment.target: For example:

segment.source: If DISM /Resetbase is a long-running operation, you can specify the /Defer parameter with /Resetbase to defer any long-running cleanup operations to the next automatic maintenance.
segment.target: If DISM /Resetbase is a long-running operation, you can specify the /Defer parameter with /Resetbase to defer any long-running cleanup operations to the next automatic maintenance.

segment.source: But we highly recommend you only use /Defer as an option in the factory where DISM /Resetbase requires more than 30 minutes to complete.
segment.target: But we highly recommend you only use /Defer as an option in the factory where DISM /Resetbase requires more than 30 minutes to complete.

segment.source: Commit the changes and unmounts the image in order to save the changes that you’ve made.
segment.target: Commit the changes and unmounts the image in order to save the changes that you’ve made.

segment.source: For example:
segment.target: For example:
